createTable.remarks: A minimal reference to a delay.

column.name: ACKNOWLEDGE
column.remarks: Indication of whether or not this delay requires acknowledgement after becoming active. A null value indicates that the default for the delay type should be used.

column.name: ACKNOWLEDGED
column.remarks: Indication of whether or not the delay has been acknowledged by the Mine Controller. This value is only relevant if this delay requires and acknowledgement. See 'acknowledge'.

column.name: CONFIRMED
column.remarks: Indication of whether or not the delay has been confirmed by the Mine Controller. This value is only relevant if this delay requires confirmation. See 'officeConfirm'.

column.name: FREQUENCY_TYPE
column.remarks: The frequency that this delay will repeat. Single/Daily/Weekly/Each Shift

column.name: SHIFT_TYPE
column.remarks: If repeating for a Shift, then this is the shift type that this delay will repeat for. Day/Night/Morning/Afternoon/Evening

column.name: DELAYCLASS
column.remarks: The class, type, or categorisation of this delay.

column.name: TARGET_MACHINE
column.remarks: The machine affected by this delay.

column.name: TARGET_ROAD
column.remarks: The road affected by this delay.

column.name: TARGET_LOCATION
column.remarks: The location affected by this delay.

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.remarks: A free form description of the delay.

column.name: FINISH_UTC
column.remarks: The time the delay finished, or the expected finishing time if the delay has not yet finished.

column.name: OFFICECONFIRM
column.remarks: Indication of whether or not this delay requires confirmation before becoming active.

column.name: REPORTEDBY_PERSON
column.remarks: The machine operator who created this delay.

column.name: REPORTEDBY_USER
column.remarks: The office user who created this delay.

column.name: START1_UTC
column.remarks: The time the delay started, or is scheduled to start.

column.name: STATUS
column.remarks: The current state of the delay. Valid values are: 0 - Unknown. 1 - Inactive, meaning not yet started. 2 - Inactive, and requiring confirmation. 3 - Active. 4 - Active, are awaiting acknowledgement. 5 - Active, and within 5 minutes of the end time. 6 - Active, and past the end time. 7 - Historical, meaning the delay is over.

column.name: PRODUCTIONREPORTINGONLY
column.remarks: Indicates whether or not this delay is a 'true' delay, or simply a convenience for production reporting. Machines on a production reporting delay will continue to be assigned.

column.name: FIELDNOTIFICATIONREQUIRED
column.remarks: Indicates the state of field communications with regard to this delay.

column.name: ENGINESTOPPED
column.remarks: Indicates whether or not the target's engine will be switched off during this delay. A null value indicates that the default from the delay type should be used.

column.name: WORKORDER_REF
column.remarks: The work order reference to be attached to this delay

column.remarks: The equipment location information associated with the event.

column.remarks: The equipment state information associated with the event.
